support.name: Support
support.description: User support issues, bug reports, help requests, pollen/reward questions, voting/feedback, technical assistance

priorities.Urgent: Critical bugs, service-breaking issues, security issues, user completely blocked
priorities.High: Important bugs, pollen/reward related, crash reports, blocking issues
priorities.Medium: Regular bugs, help questions, feature feedback

dev.name: Dev
dev.description: Feature requests, implementation tasks, code improvements, development work, new features

priorities.High: Critical features, security improvements, critical fixes

news.name: News
news.description: PR submissions announcing updates, releases, changelog entries, newsworthy changes

priorities.High: Major releases, critical updates, important announcements, security updates
priorities.Medium: Regular updates, feature announcements, workflow improvements
priorities.Low: Minor updates, documentation changes, social media posts

labels.EXTERNAL: External contributions, third-party PRs (not from org members)

classification_guidelines.note: These are guidelines only. Use AI judgment based on context and impact. Each issue/PR must go to EXACTLY ONE project.

project_assignment.support: User-facing issues: bugs users encounter, support requests, blockers, pollen/reward questions, voting/feedback. Use when user impact is primary concern.
project_assignment.dev: Internal development work: feature requests for new capabilities, code improvements, architecture, internal tasks. Use when development effort is primary concern.
project_assignment.news: PR submissions that represent releases, updates, or announcements. Use for PRs that introduce versioned changes or major milestones.

support.Urgent: User completely blocked or unable to use service (service down, critical bug, security breach)
support.High: Significant user impact (crashes, pollen system issues, blocking workflows)
support.Medium: Regular bugs or help questions with moderate impact

dev.High: Critical system improvements, security fixes, breaking changes needed
dev.Medium: Regular features, optimizations, code quality improvements

news.High: Major releases, critical security updates, significant milestones
news.Medium: Regular updates, feature releases, workflow improvements

classification_guidelines.single_project_rule: Each issue or PR must be assigned to ONLY ONE project. If it spans multiple areas, prioritize based on primary impact: user-facing → support, development work → dev, release announcement → news.
